pageTitle: BBC Sport - Premier League predictions: Lawro v Biffy Clyro singer Simon Neil
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {924=A lifelong Rangers fan, Neil paired the Glasgow club with city rivals Celtic when he and bandmate James Johnstone made the draw for the Scottish Cup fifth round in the 2010-11 season., 5439=5 May 2014 Last updated at 21:18 GMT}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {49286=Copyright © 2015 BBC. The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites. Read more.}
textBeforeTable: Biffy Clyro will headline this summer's T In The Park and Isle of Wight Festivals, and have a new album out later this year. "I am still into football as much now, but the last couple of years as a Rangers fan have not been quite so enjoyable, that's for sure!" "The first game I went to see was Rangers v Motherwell when I was five," he added. "I remember it vividly because I wrote a big story about it at school. My dad took me to games until I was about 15 so Rangers were a big part of my childhood. textAfterTable: 0-1 SUNDAY Arsenal v West Brom 1-0 3-0 4-0 Chelsea v Norwich 0-0 2-0 2-0 MONDAY Crystal Palace v Liverpool 3-3 1-1 1-4 A correct result (ie picking a win, draw or defeat) is worth ONE point. A correct score earns THREE points. Last weekend, Lawro got seven correct results from 10 Premier League games, with no perfect scores. His tally of seven points saw him beaten by 'Bad Neighbours' actor Zac Efron, who got five correct results, including three perfect scores, for a total of 11 points. We're keeping a record of the totals for Lawro and his guests (below), and showing a table of how the Premier League would look if all of Lawro's predictions were correct (at the bottom of the page).
